description.narrative: The objective of the Project is to strengthen the local government financing system and improve local service delivery in rural communes and to provide an immediate and effective response in the event of Eligible Emergency or Crisis

participating-org.narrative: Ministry of Decentralization and Territorial Administration

title.narrative: The number of selected CRs where the technical staff of the Sub-prefecture have been detached to the Mayor
Percentage of CRs where the past investments in infrastructure were incomplete and have benefitted from complementary micro-projects.
Percentage of elected mayors and key staff trained (retrained) in local governance and the use of fiduciary tools
Percentage of targeted CRs where Local Development Plans have been updated in a participatory manner.
Number of micro-projects financed by sub-component :
• Sub-component 1.4 Micro-projects in CRs located in mining areas
• Sub-component 1.3 Inter-community micro-projects in natural resources management and bio-diversity protection
Micro-projects or investments for which arrangements for community engagement in post-project sustainability and/or operations and maintenance are established
Percentage of deconcentrated technical staff that were trained to support Local Development
• Sub-component 1.2 Micro-projects in CRs most affected by the Ebola Epidemic
Percentage of PACV3-funded infrastructures audited that are certified to be in compliance with the appropriate technical and environmental norms
Funds from FNDL are executed by CRs
• Sub-component 1.1 Complementary investments in PACV2 micro-projects
Number of CRs using PACV’s participatory budgeting, monitoring and evaluation system
Number of direct beneficiaries (disaggregated by gender)
Percentage of women and youth in different committees in selected CRs
Beneficiaries that feel project investments reflected their needs (percentage)
Percentage of CR having increased collection of their annual revenues by at least 10% compared to the previous year
A National Fund for Local Development (FNDL) is established and operational
A National Government Agency is providing technical assistance to CRs
A computerized system for M&E at all levels is operational
The Government transfers annually to Local Communities 15% of mining revenues as foreseen in Article 165 of the Mining Code
Percentage of recorded conflict risk issues that have been resolved by action groups through the pilot Early Warning and Response System (EWRS) implemented in the targeted CRs
There was no indicator set for this component.
This component is only for emergency.
